title: replace use of pkg_resources (entry points, versions) with importlib
body:
From https://setuptools.readthedocs.io/en/latest/pkg_resources.html 

"Use of pkg_resources is discouraged in favor of importlib.resources, importlib.metadata, and their backports (resources, metadata)." (backports are needed before 3.8).

Here is the grep for points of our use of pkg_resources

```
datalad/api.py:    from pkg_resources import iter_entry_points
datalad/cmdline/main.py:    from pkg_resources import iter_entry_points  # delay expensive import
datalad/cmdline/tests/test_main.py:            assert_not_in('pkg_resources', content)
datalad/interface/run_procedure.py:    from pkg_resources import iter_entry_points
datalad/interface/run_procedure.py:    from pkg_resources import resource_isdir
datalad/interface/run_procedure.py:    from pkg_resources import resource_filename
datalad/interface/test.py:            from pkg_resources import iter_entry_points
datalad/metadata/extractors/tests/test_base.py:from pkg_resources import iter_entry_points
datalad/metadata/metadata.py:    from pkg_resources import iter_entry_points  # delayed heavy import
datalad/metadata/search.py:        from pkg_resources import EntryPoint, iter_entry_points
datalad/metadata/tests/test_search.py:from pkg_resources import EntryPoint
datalad/metadata/tests/test_search.py:    with patch('pkg_resources.iter_entry_points',
datalad/metadata/tests/test_search.py:    with patch('pkg_resources.iter_entry_points',
datalad/metadata/tests/test_search.py:    with patch('pkg_resources.iter_entry_points',
datalad/plugin/wtf.py:    from pkg_resources import iter_entry_points
datalad/plugin/wtf.py:    from pkg_resources import iter_entry_points
datalad/support/external_versions.py:        # try pkg_resources
datalad/support/external_versions.py:                import pkg_resources
datalad/support/external_versions.py:                version = pkg_resources.get_distribution(value.__name__).version
datalad/support/third/nosetester.py:            # Relies on pkg_resources, not a hard dependency
```

entry points and versions checks should be easy to RF, although I don't know if it would not effect performance anyhow (important for entry points).

I guess we should do that for `master` and not `maint`.
